item.title: Nioh 3: How to Find and Pet All Chijiko in Warring States
item.description:
Chijiko in Nioh 3 are floating lanterns that players can shoot down using a bow or a gun. They usually move around but stop for a few seconds, giving players ample time to adjust their shots. Once the Chijiko come down, players can pet them to get a Ninja or Samurai Locks as well as Transformed Arts . The guide below lists the 21 Chijiko locations in Warring States in Nioh 3 .

How to Find All Warring States Chijiko in Nioh 3

Tenryu River

  • Recommended Level: 6

From the Ikeda Ferry Shrine in Tokaido , head north to find some houses, and the first Chijiko is floating above them.

Tenryu River

  • Recommended Level: 6

From the Hojo Shrine , head north until you spot the Chijiko.

Hamamatsu

  • Recommended Level: 10

Soon after entering Hamamatsu and reaching the Hamamatsu Post Shrine , you can find this to your left.

Hamamatsu

  • Recommended Level: 10

After clearing the Crucible mission and defeating Jakotsu-Baba, you will reach the top of the Hamamatsu Castle . From the top, jump down onto the roof tiles and keep going down until you can spot the Chijiko floating and within the reach of your arrows.​​​​​​​

Maisaka

  • Recommended Level: 19

Keep going west of Maisaka , and instead of going straight for the Maisaka Post , look for a path left that leads to this collectible.​​​​​​​

Maisaka

​​​​​​​

  • Recommended Level: 19

Go down to the extreme south of this region near the Haunting Caves to find the second Chijiko in Maisaka.​​​​​​​

Lake Sanaru

  • Recommended Level: 19

After clearing out the enemy base on the ship, you can climb a few boxes to get the Chijiko in sight and shoot it down.​​​​​​​

Lake Sanaru

  • Recommended Level: 19

From the Lake Sanaru (North) Shrine , head east to find this collectible.​​​​​​​

Mikataghara

  • Recommended Level: 20

This one is located right next to the bridge at the entrance of Mikatagahara . You can shoot it from the Otsuri Bridge Shrine next to the bridge.​​​​​​​

Mikataghara

  • Recommended Level: 20

Follow the road north until you reach the enemy base. Clear this, and look in the same area for the Chijiko.​​​​​​​

Hamamatsu Hill

  • Recommended Level: 24

From the Hachiman Shrine Walk , head west to find it.​​​​​​​

Hamamatsu Hill

  • Recommended Level: 24

After collecting the previous collectible, head northeast, taking the path on the right, and you will spot the Chijiko on your left.​​​​​​​

Hamamatsu Hill

  • Recommended Level: 24

This time, take the path left and keep going until you get close to the Mikatagahara Junction Shrine , and before reaching it, you can find the collectible on your left.​​​​​​​

Hamamatsu Hill

  • Recommended Level: 24

Go to the extreme northwest of this region, through the area filled with enemies. Head left, taking the path that leads to Iinoya , and you will find this on your way.​​​​​​​

Lake Hamana

  • Recommended Level: 25

During the Disaster at Lake Hamana myth, you will come to the Horie Castle , where you can find this.​​​​​​​

Iinoya

  • Recommended Level: 28

Head east of Temple Ruins to reach the Sengen Waterfall Shrine . Head south to find this Chijiko.​​​​​​​

Iinoya

  • Recommended Level: 28

From the Omomiji Junction , head west all the way to the end to find this.​​​​​​​

Iinoya

  • Recommended Level: 28

From the previous collectible, head south, then take a left to find the third Chijiko of this region, right before the area with the Crucible Wraith .​​​​​​​

Futamata Road

  • Recommended Level: 35

From the Silver Grass Meadow Shrine , head east, and there should be a path leading to the Chijiko.​​​​​​​

Futamata Road

  • Recommended Level: 35

This is located near the Firefly Forest ; you can fast travel to the Juji Fortress (East) Shrine and head further east, getting close to the forest to spot the collectible.

Futamata

  • Recommended Level: 36

The last Chijiko is near the castle town shrine; you will be able to spot it from the bridge and shoot it down.

item.title: Helldivers 2 – Is Super Citizen Edition Worth It?
item.description:
Helldivers 2 is an exceptional game, and one where the fun never seems to end, because the war will never end. With Terminids, Illuminate, and Automatons waging an all-out galactic war on Super Earth, the Helldivers are the only thing to stand for liberty and managed democracy, which is why you need to figure out which edition of Helldivers 2 to buy so you can join the fight.

Even those who have had Helldivers 2 for over two years might not know if the Super Citizen Edition is worth the asking price, as this upgrade comes with a few goodies, but is it worth the extra cash? Find out below as we talk you through all the benefits of the Super Citizen Edition and whether you should get it or not as a veteran or a new recruit.

What Does the Super Citizen Edition Come With in Helldivers 2?

The Super Citizen Edition of Helldivers 2 comes with the following bonuses:

  • DP-54 Savior of the Free Armor Set
  • Will of the People Cape
  • MP-98 Knight Weapon
  • Super Citizen Title
  • Stratagem Hero Ship Game
  • Premium Warbond Token

Most of the benefits from the Super Citizen Edition, like the Super Citizen Title, are cosmetic only and a way to show your support to the devs at Arrowhead Game Studios. The Armor Set has the Democracy Protects buff, which is a C-Tier Passive , and the MP-98 Knight is a fairly good SMG, but requires heaps of ammo .

The real benefit of the Super Citizen Edition is the Premium Warbond Token, which will allow you to purchase any Warbond of your choice (not Killzone or Halo ). In previous years, the Super Citizen Edition used to come with the Steeled Veterans Warbond, but now players can choose any of them.

The last real benefit of Super Citizen Edition is the Stratagem Hero Ship Game, which is a fun minigame that sees you enter Stratagem Codes as fast as you can to build your highscore . It's fun to play and learn new Stratagems, and also fun to compete with fellow Helldivers.

Is the Super Citizen Edition Worth It in Helldivers 2?

The question on if the Super Citizen Edition of Helldivers 2 is worth it or not depends on what you want out of the game. If you have been enjoying Helldivers 2 and want to support the devs by providing them with some extra money for a few fun bonuses, then it is worth it, as the Stratagem Hero Ship Game can be fun , and the Premium Warbond Token is great for getting you any Warbond for free without spending $9.99 for 1,000 Super Credits.

When not on sale, the Super Citizen Edition Upgrade is $15, which is $6 more than the Super Credits needed for a Warbond, but you get to support the devs and get the Stratagem Hero Ship Game!

item.title: Nioh 3: How to Unlock the Second Melee Weapon Slot
item.description:
Nioh 3 allows players to unlock two melee weapon slots and switch between them during combat. However, the secondary melee weapon slot isn't available from the get-go, and players will need to complete a specific quest to get this feature. Here's a quick guide that will help you unlock the second melee weapon slot in Nioh 3 and explain how you can switch between weapons on-the-go.

How to Unlock the Second Melee Weapon Slot in Nioh 3

Players can unlock the second melee weapon slot for the Samurai style by completing the Way of the Warrior: Adept quest in Nioh 3 . This is part of the training questline that players can undertake in the Eternal Rift by talking to Takechiyo's former teacher, Yagyu Munenori.

To start the Way of the Warrior quests, players will need to interact with a Shrine and go into the Battle Scroll menu.

Way of the Warrior: Adept is the second quest that unlocks after players reach the Heian era by defeating the Warring States boss, Takeda Shingen. This quest will pit Takechiyo against Yagyu Munenori himself in a sparring match.

You'll need to carefully dodge his sword swipes and focus on consistently attacking him to destroy his stance . Once the stance is broken, you'll be able to deliver a critical strike that will chop off a significant amount of health. Keep repeating this process until you've finally defeated the mini-boss and completed the Way of the Warrior: Adept quest in Nioh 3 .

Once you've defeated Yagyu Munenori, the Way of the Warrior: Adept quest will be completed, and you'll earn Samurai's Locks, Great Tengu Blade, and Swordmaster's Robe as rewards. Once you enter the equipment menu after completing the mission, you'll receive a prompt about unlocking the secondary melee weapon slot in Nioh 3 .

This is really great for players who want to deal with enemies that have different affinities as weaknesses, but don't want to head into the equipment menu again and again.
